title: Water Board confirms no data breach due to cyberattack on SMS system
byline: The National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) has stated that no data has been compromised as a result of the cyberattack targeting its SMS (short message service) system.

title: Australia Deputy PM arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Defence of Australia Richard Marles has arrived in the island on an official visit.

title: Medical lab fined Rs. 500,000 for charging excessive fee for FBC test
byline: Operators of a medical laboratory in Malwana have been fined Rs. 500,000 for charging an excessive fee for a Full Blood Count (FBC) test.

title: South Korea votes for new president after months of turmoil
byline: South Korean voters headed to the polls to pick a new president, with the two leading candidates vowing to revive an ailing economy and put months of turmoil over a failed martial law attempt in the rearview mirror.

title: Showers expected in several areas today
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in the Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central and North-western provinces and in the Galle and Matara districts today, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Measures needed to be taken to address human-elephant conflict discussed
byline: A high-level meeting was held today (02) under the patronage of the Minister of Public Administration, Local Government, and Provincial Councils, Dr. A.H.M.H. Abeyratne, to discuss and find sustainable solutions to mitigate the escalating incidents of human-elephant conflict.

title: People seeking overseas employment down by 20% - ALFEA
byline: The number of individuals seeking employment overseas has reduced by about 20% in comparison to recent years, according to the Association of Licensed Foreign Employment Agencies (ALFEA).

title: Sri Lankan detained while attempting to cross Azerbaijan border with forged documents
byline: A Sri Lankan citizen attempting to cross the state border of Azerbaijan using documents belonging to another individual has been detained, the Press Center of the State Border Service of Azerbaijan said.

title: Italy’s Mount Etna erupts as large plumes rise from volcano
byline: Italy’s Mount Etna has erupted, with large plumes of ash and smoke seen rising from the volcano.

title: Two more arrested over shooting Thusitha Halloluwa’s vehicle
byline: Another two individuals have been arrested over the shooting incident targeting the vehicle of former Executive Director of the National Lotteries Board, Thusitha Halloluwa, in Narahenpita, Police said.

title: Novel SARS-CoV-2 variants not detected in Sri Lanka: Health Secretary
byline: Novel variants of SARS-CoV-2 virus that cause COVID-19 disease have not been detected in Sri Lanka, Secretary to the Ministry of Health Dr. Anil Jasinghe has confirmed.

title: 3,000 families in 13 districts affected by adverse weather across Sri Lanka
byline: A total of 11,469 individuals from 3,064 families have been affected by the adverse weather conditions prevailing in the country, according to the Disaster Management Center (DMC).

title: Seabed clean-up operation commences in Pigeon Island
byline: A seabed clean-up operation was officially launched today (02) in the Pigeon Island off the coast of Trincomalee.

title: Ex-chairman of Lindula-Talawakelle UC Asoka Sepala remanded
byline: Former chairman of the Lindula-Talawakelle Urban Council Asoka Sepala, who was arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) earlier today, has been remanded until June 11, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: All necessary procedures to launch Starlink services in Sri Lanka competed: Dy Minister
byline: The government has completed all necessary procedures to launch Starlink services in Sri Lanka, says Deputy Minister of Digital Economy Eranga Weeraratne.

title: “No more pageants. I did my best for Sri Lanka” – Anudi bids farewell to pageantry
byline: Anudi Gunasekara, who represented Sri Lanka at the 72nd Miss World pageant held in India, returned to the island today (June 2).

title: Indian man arrested with 47 venomous vipers in bag at Mumbai airport
byline: Authorities in India have arrested a man for trying to smuggle dozens of rare reptiles, including venomous snakes, into the country.

title: Drug trafficker ‘San Sudda’ escapes from hospital while in custody
byline: Drug trafficker known as ‘San Sudda’, who was arrested by Police last week, has escaped from the hospital while under the custody of prison officers.

title: Keheliya Rambukwella and son granted bail
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has ordered the release of former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella and his son, Ramith Rambukwella, on bail.

title: Cabinet greenlights establishment of metro bus unit
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval for the establishment of a Metro Bus Unit for urban transportation.

title: Ex-Minister Piyasena Gamage arrives at Bribery Commission
byline: Former Minister Piyasena Gamage has arrived at the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) to record a statement.

title: Substandard drugs import: Keheliya and other accused to be indicted before HC judge bench
byline: The Attorney General has informed the Supreme Court today (03) that former Health Minister Keheliya Rambukwella and the other accused in the case filed over the alleged importation of substandard human immunoglobulin vaccines, will be indicted before a three-member bench of High Court judges next week, Ada Derana Reporter said.

title: Cabinet Spokesman dismisses rumours of move to replace PM Harini
byline: No discussion has taken place to replace Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya from the position, Cabinet Spokesman Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa stated.

title: Ex-Minister Piyasena Gamage leaves Bribery Commission
byline: Former Minister Piyasena Gamage has left the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) after recording a statement.

title: Settlement reached over petition filed by Sri Lankan cricketers against IRD
byline: A settlement was reached today before the Court of Appeal regarding the petition filed by national cricketers against a decision made by the Inland Revenue Department to impose withholding tax on them by treating them as employees of Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC), Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Mongolian PM resigns after losing parliament backing, street protests
byline: Mongolia’s Prime Minister Luvsannamsrai Oyun-Erdene has stepped down after losing parliamentary support following corruption claims that erupted into street protests last month, the country’s parliament said on Tuesday.

title: Sri Lanka sees record tourist arrivals in May 2025
byline: A total of 132,919 tourists have arrived in the country in May 2025, data from the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) shows.

title: Teenage girl dead and 69 injured after earthquake hits holiday hotspots in Turkey
byline: Concern was sparked among the residents of Rhodes by the 5.8 magnitude earthquake that occurred off the island in the early hours of Tuesday.

title: ASPI hits new all-time high as market surges
byline: The All Share Price Index (ASPI) of the Colombo Stock Exchange closed at an all-time high today (03), after making significant gains before trading closed.

title: Man beheads pregnant wife, surrenders to police with severed head
byline: A man has allegedly murdered and beheaded his pregnant wife before later surrendering to the police with the served head and murder weapon this morning (June 3) in the Puliyankulama area of Vavuniya.

title: Disney makes hundreds more layoffs as it cuts costs
byline: Disney says it is laying off several hundred more people around the world, with workers in its film, television and finance departments impacted.

title: Bill Gates to give most of his $200bn fortune to Africa
byline: Microsoft founder Bill Gates says that most of his fortune will be spent on improving health and education services in Africa over the next 20 years.

title: 18,000 MT of maize to be imported for ‘Thriposha’ production
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to issue a permit to the Sri Lanka Thriposha Limited Company to import 18,000 metric tons of maize.

title: Prof. Udayanga Hemapala appointed new CEB Chairman
byline: Professor K.T.M. Udayanga Hemapala has been appointed as the new Chairman of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) following the resignation of Dr. Tilak Siyambalapitiya.

title: Parliamentary session commences
byline: The Parliamentary session commenced at 9:30 a.m. today (June 3).

title: Man fatally stabbed following personal dispute in Katuneriya
byline: A 43-year-old man was stabbed to death with a sharp weapon in St. Anthony Mawatha, Katuneriya, Marawila last evening (02).

title: FDA authorizes first AI platform for breast cancer prediction
byline: Clairity, Inc., a digital health innovator advancing AI-driven healthcare solutions, has received U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) De Novo authorization for Clairity Breast, a novel, image-based prognostic platform designed to predict five-year breast cancer risk from a routine screening mammogram.

title: Technical College student attempts suicide over ragging incident
byline: Four students of the Kuliyapitiya Technical College have been taken into custody in connection with an attempted suicide by a fellow student allegedly over a ragging incident.

title: Tesla is ‘not interested’ in producing cars in India – minister
byline: Elon Musk-owned electric vehicle (EV) giant Tesla is “not interested in manufacturing in India”, the country’s heavy industries minister has said.

title: Keheliya Rambukwella and son produced before Court
byline: Former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella and his son, Ramith Rambukwella, who are currently in remand custody, were brought before the Colombo Magistrate’s Court today by prison officials.

title: Govt to remove legal barriers for return of refugees from India
byline: The government has decided to remove the existing legal barriers for individuals who fled the country during the conflict with the LTTE and have been residing in India as refugees, in order to facilitate their return to Sri Lanka.

title: President holds discussion with visiting Australia Deputy PM
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has held discussions with visiting Deputy Prime Minister and Minister for Defence of Australia Richard Marles, this morning (03) at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: More than 200 prisoners break out of Pakistani jail after earthquake panic
byline: More than 200 inmates escaped from a jail in the southern Pakistani city of Karachi late on Monday when they overpowered prison guards after being allowed to leave their cells following a series of earthquakes, local officials and police said.

title: Strategic plan launched to revitalize Sri Lanka’s dairy industry
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake held a discussion this morning (03) at the Presidential Secretariat with senior officials of the Ministry of Agriculture, focusing on the revitalization of the local dairy industry.

title: Cabinet approves task force to revive Sri Lanka’s swine industry
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval for the appointment of a task force to revive the swine industry in the country which has collapsed due to African swine fever (ASF).

title: SriLankan Airlines’ new A330 to perform low fly-past over Colombo tomorrow
byline: The newly acquired Airbus A330-200 aircraft by SriLankan Airlines is scheduled to arrive in Sri Lanka tomorrow (June 4).

title: Sri Lanka–Australia bilateral talks bolster defence cooperation
byline: An Australian delegation led by the Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Defence of Australia, Richard Marles, held bilateral discussions with Sri Lanka’s Deputy Minister of Defence, Major General Aruna Jayasekara (Retd), today (03 June) at the Deputy Minister’s Office in Colombo.

title: Vietnam, Sri Lanka look to future rooted in 55 years of diplomatic ties
byline: The Vietnamese Party and State want to further deepen bilateral ties with Sri Lanka on the back of close friendship, high political trust, and shared values and interests, said Politburo member and Chairman of the Party Central Committee’s Commission for Information, Education and Mass Mobilisation Nguyen Trong Nghia.

title: South Korea’s liberal opposition candidate Lee is expected to win election, exit poll shows
byline: South Korea’s liberal opposition candidate Lee Jae-myung was expected to win an early presidential election on Tuesday, vote counts and media projections suggested.
